value.string: The purpose of this Bot is...
1. Log the Event to .CSV log file
2. Based on Excel Event Config, send email notification as necessary.
It assumes... (ie. what should be true to execute?  A window is open? file open? etc)
Input includes... and it outputs a status value oStrStatus (blank indicating success)
TODO: Set variable iBoolUnitTesting to TRUE if Unit Testing
NOTE: If Unit Testing, Logging via LOGINFO not enabled, but message boxes can be used at key process steps.
Event configuration file could not be found.
NOTE: If Unit Testing, Logging via LOGINFO not enabled, but message boxes can be used at key process steps.
TODO: Set variable iBoolUnitTestingEnabled to TRUE if Unit Testing
Set Unit Testing value if input from calling Bot.
EXCEPTION_005 - File/Folder Path Dictionary not populated

value.expression: Cannot locate event config file path here: $pStrFilePathEventConfig$

value.string: Unknown Environment - ensure populated in Config dictionary (via ReadConfig)
EXCEPTION_005 - Process Attributes Dictionary not populated
Note: Main Bot is responsible to validate if logging enabled.
LogInfo simply exits if it is false, although better not to bother calling it if disabled.
Errors/Exceptions output in oStrStatus are prefixed with one of these values.
These prefixes indicate that the Error/Exception has been logged/handled by the child/sub Bot.
Cannot use LOGINFO if Unit Testing (requires input dictionaries)
This is an error that occurred.
Assign all required variables to Unit Test the Bot, that normally get passed from calling Bot.
Read Event Config from CSV or Excel
NOTE: With CSV, only a single config file for all environments.
NOTE: With Excel, different worksheet of Excel config file for each environment.
Assign Subject from Event Config, OR input variable if over-ridden.
Assign TO recipients from Event Config, OR input variable if over-ridden.
Assign CC recipients from Event Config, OR input variable if over-ridden.
Read Event Record into String Vars

value.expression: Event Code $iStrEventCode$ could not be found.

value.string: Find the Event Code in Config
Unknown connection type - expected Outlook or EWS.
oStrStatus will contain Error/Exception prefix value.

variables.name: prompt-assignment
variables.description: A variable you can use for assignments

variables.name: oStrStatus
variables.description: Status value to be returned to calling Bot.

variables.name: pStrTaskName
variables.description: Name of this Bot (ex. Raise Process Event)

variables.name: iStrTaskName
variables.description: Name of Bot that called Raise Process Event

variables.name: oBoolFatalError
variables.description: Returns TRUE if this type of event is a fatal error, per configuration file.

variables.name: iStrAttachmentPaths
variables.description: Paths to attachments that should be attached to email; paths delimited by ;

variables.name: pStrEmailConnectionType
variables.description: Email connection type to send email notifications.  EWS or Outlook.  For the former, passing username and password credentials is mandatory.

variables.name: iCredSendEmailUser
variables.description: User if sending email notification via SMTP or Exchange Web Services (EWS)

variables.name: iCredSendEmailPassword
variables.description: Password if sending email notification via SMTP or Exchange Web Services (EWS)

variables.name: iStrEmailCCRecipients
variables.description: Email CC recipients who will receive the event notifications, if need to over-ride the CC recipients in the Event Config file.

variables.name: iStrEmailTORecipients
variables.description: Email recipients who will receive the event notifications, if need to over-ride the recipients in the Event Config file.

variables.name: iStrEmailSubject
variables.description: Email subject of event notification, if need to over-ride the value in the Event Config file.

variables.name: pFileEventConfig
variables.description: Event config in CSV or XLSX format.
